tips: onions increase appetite, and go with virtually all savory foods.

name: pepper, black
tips: pepper suggests “false heat” and also stimulates the appetite. add at the end of the cooking process.

name: rosemary
tips: add early in the cooking process. in winter, rosemary is milder; in summer, it is stronger.

name: sauerkraut
tips: sauerkraut is shredded cabbage that is fermented in salt and spices.

tips: sweetness satiates the appetite, so generally end a meal on a sweet note. even sweet desserts should be in balance (their acidity, saltiness, etc.). dessert wine should always be sweeter than the dessert it accompanies.

tips: always use chervil fresh, not cooked.

tips: add at the end of the cooking process.

name: mint
tips: mint generally refers to spearmint. mint suggests “false coolness” and adds a note of freshness to dishes.

name: parsley
tips: use fresh. parsley generally refers to flat-leaf parsley. parsley is great for blending, as it is compatible with virtually all other herbs.

name: calvados

name: celery root
tips: always peel before using.

name: horseradish
tips: use horseradish raw or add at end of cooking process. heat diminishes the pungency of horseradish.

name: sour cream
tips: use fresh, or cook at low temperatures only.

name: bananas

name: game
tips: the flavor of cloves adds richness to game.

name: saffron
tips: add later in the cooking process; saffron is activated by the heat of cooking. this bright yellow/orange-hued spice is used for its color as well as its flavor. a little saffron goes a very long way, never add more than necessary.

name: artichokes
techniques: bake, boil, braise, broil, deep-fry, grill, raw, roast, sauté, steam, stew

name: sage
tips: always use cooked (never raw); add near the end of the cooking process.

name: savory
volume: moderate–loud (summer savory is quieter while winter savory is louder.)
tips: can stand up to cooking. use summer savory with summer vegetables, and winter savory with winter vegetables.

name: dill
tips: always use dill fresh, not cooked.

tips: use cilantro to provide a cooling note to chile pepper– spiced dishes.
